resource.chars:
the coast line from C. Washington to McMurdo 
Bay with some care 
We found on the West Coast of the latter two 
excellent harbours 
They are respectively in Lat 76.55S & Lat 
77.30S (approximately) 
It is my intention to return to one of these 
spots for the winter, preferably the Southern.
I shall now proceed along the great barrier 
and endeavour to explore its eastern Extremity 
I am directing the Commander of the relief 
ship to proceed to <s>one of <\s> these harbours 
above mentioned with such coal & stores as 
he is bringing to our aid 
All onboard are well 
We have laid in a considerable stock of 
seal flesh for winter consumption 
I have the honor to be 
Sirs 
Your obedient servant 
Robt F Scott 
The President of the Royal Society 
The President of the Royal Geographical 
Society
